install.description:
MathPublisher (v 1.8)

Allows you to include math formulae sections in your Joomla 1.6 or 1.5 content using {mathpublisher} or a custom tag.
Plugin uses phpMathPublisher by Pascal Brachet from http://www.xm1math.net/phpmathpublisher/
Usage example: {mathpublisher}pi=sum{n=0}{+infty}{{(n!)^2 2^{n+1}}/{(2n+1)!}}{/mathpublisher}

Remember to enable and configure using Plugin Manager

field.name: alternativetag
field.label: Alternative tag to trigger the plugin usage.
field.description: If you think that {mathpublisher} is too long and prefer shorter syntax, feel free to specify your own tag. For example: math (avoid very short tags e.g. m - consider sum{m}{n}{p})

field.name: joomla_url_root
field.label: This is where joomla is accessed from your sites root url
field.description: Leave empty if Joomla is accessed from you sites root url. Otherwise use 'joomla' for http://my.site/joomla/* or '~user' for . http://my.site/~user/* etc.

field.name: bg_color
field.label: Background color (html #rrggbb style e.g. #ff8844 or #f84)
field.description: The background color - used for anti-aliasing which makes the characters look smoother. Choose a value that is close to the average background color behind the formula.

field.name: enable_in_comments
field.label: Enable in comments
field.description: Select Yes to allow math to be used in comments. Tested with JComments on Joomla 1.5 only.
